thread.title: India soar in Kiwiland

author: tribuneindia.com
title: India soar in Kiwiland
text:
New Delhi, October 11
India eked out a draw (1-1) against New Zealand in the final hockey Test to pocket the four-match series 2-1 in Christchurch. After goalless opening two quarters, Nick Ross broke the deadlock for New Zealand in the 41st minute. But the hosts’ joy was short-lived as India equalised two minutes later through a field goal from SV Sunil (43rd). The first quarter of the game witnessed a series of attacks from India, who dominated the entire session. Skipper Sardar Singh broke through the hosts’ defence from the right flank but his attack was foiled by Alex Shaw. In the 11th minute, India were awarded a penalty corner but Rupinder Pal Singh’s effort missed the target. New Zealand then put some pressure on the Indian defence with a long pass from Blair Tarrant, who found Nic Woods in a goal-scoring position but his effort was denied by an alert Indian defence. The dying moments of the first quarter saw Akashdeep Singh get a chance to open the account but his attempt went wide of the post. In the second quarter, the Black Sticks dominated the early part with an attack from the left side, which earned them a penalty corner, but goalkeeper PR Sreejesh made a good save. This was followed by a counter-attack from India but an unmarked Dharamvir Singh’s attempt was blocked by the New Zealand goalkeeper. Akashdeep then pierced through the defence but his attempt was thwarted as both the teams failed to open their account by the half-time break. After the change of ends, both the teams tried hard to break the deadlock but could not find a way through. Finally, in the 41st minute, the game witnessed its first goal from the stick of Ross, who collected a pass from Steve Edwards and finished off the move to give the hosts a 1-0 lead. Two minutes later, India drew level through Sunil. The last quarter saw some desperate moves from both the sides but without any success. — PTI Johor Cup: India colts have great start, beat Pak 5-1 Johor Bahru: Defending champions India began their campaign in style by thrashing arch-rivals Pakistan 5-1 in the fifth Sultan of Johor Cup junior hockey tournament. The Indian boys dominated the entire match as they registered an easy win in their opening match. The Indians scored their first goal (5th min) as Ajay Yadav flicked the ball into the opposition net. Midway into the first half, India were awarded their first penalty corner but the opportunity was missed. Pakistan counter-attacked, and were given a penalty corner, but they too missed. India scored their second goal in the 23rd minute as Dipsan Tirkey, from the left flank, passed the ball to Sumit Kumar who was right in front of the goal and made no mistake in finding the net. In the 27th minute, Armaan Qureshi scored India’s third goal before adding another just before going into the break. In the 34th minute, Parvinder Singh struck a brilliant field goal. Pakistan opened their account in the 45th minute as Muhammad Dilber scored a field goal. Halfway into the second session, Harmanpreet Singh set up Santa Singh for India’s fifth goal. India will face Great Britain in their next match tomorrow. PTI
